movies.title: Le pirate
movies.plot: Toward the end of the Ching Dynasty, the South China Sea was swarming with pirates looking to plunder treasure-rich Portuguese merchant ships. A titanic tale of a daring and heroic "Robin Hood" of the seas.
movies.simplePlot: Toward the end of the Ching Dynasty, the South China Sea was swarming with pirates looking to plunder treasure-rich Portuguese merchant ships. A titanic tale of a daring and heroic "Robin Hood" of the seas.

biography.bio: Lung Ti was born on August 19, 1946 in Guangdong Province, China as Tam Fu Wing. He is an actor and director, known for A Better Tomorrow (1986), The Legend of Drunken Master (1994) and A Better Tomorrow II (1987). He has been married to Min-Ming Tao since May 22, 1975. They have one child.
biography.name: Lung Ti

biography.bio: David Chiang was born in Suzhou, China on June 29, 1947. His mother Hung Wei and father Yim Dut were very popular movie stars. Young David began his acting career at a very early age, appearing in black & white films while he was only 4 years old. "John" is David's real English name, while "David" was a stage name given to him by Director Chang Cheh. In 1966, while working as a Stuntman and Fight Instructor for the acclaimed Shaw Brothers Studio, he was spotted by Director Chang Cheh. The Director immediately saw potential & screen presence in the young actor & took David under his wing, slowly grooming him. The pair got along like father & son. With Wang Yu's sudden departure in 1969, Run Run Shaw and his senior executives were searching for their next leading man to take the reins to satisfy the frenzy left from the departed Wang Yu. The movie impresario made David an offer he could not refuse. With the guidance of Director Chang Cheh, David won "The Best Actor" Award at the 16th Asian Film Festival in 1970 for his role in "Vengeance!". In 1972, at the 18th Asian film Festival, David was awarded "The Best Actor" for his role in "Blood Brothers" & "The Most Contemporary" Award in 1973 at the 19th Asian Film Festival for "The Generation Gap". David left Hong Kong with his mentor Chang Cheh and set up an Independent Production Company in 1973 known as Chang's Scope Company. With the backing & blessings of Run Run Shaw, their films continued to be distributed through an enormous Shaw circuit. There, David was able to try his hand at directing, producing and script writing. As the 70s came to an end and the 80s approached, David continued to work his magic on the silver screen working with Directors Lee Han Chiang, Hsueh Li Pao, Ho Meng-hua and Chia-Liang Liu. 1980 was also the start of his first TV series "The Green Dragon Conspiracy", followed by "Princess Chang Ping" and "Dynasty" which are all classics. In the mid 80s, David worked alongside his two brothers, Paul Chun & Derek Yee, directing, producing and acting in the comedy "Legend of the Owl". David's talents in comedy also was showcased in the movies "The Challenger" and "The Loot" directed by Eric Tseng . In late 80s into the 90s David successfully directed movies: "Heaven Can Help", "Silent Love", "The Wrong Couples", "Mr. Handsome", "Double Fattiness", "My Dear Son", "Will of Iron" and "Mother of a Different Kind" . In 1991, David and his family emigrated from Hong Kong to Vancouver, Canada, returning to Hong Kong to make one or two TV series each year. As 2000 approached, David has continued to work in movies & TV series. He was nominated for "Best Supporting Actor" in 2006 for his role in "Revolving Doors of Vengeance". With over 4 decades under his belt, David is indeed an icon and a legend and is well regarded as one of Kung Fu's top action heroes.
biography.name: David Chiang

biography.bio: A Shanghai native with roots from Hunan province, Shaw Brothers contract character actor Tien Ching is known by many for his less than flattering roles playing his signature cuckold, impotent, lecherous, slippery, smarmy, back-stabbing roles in countless martial arts, exploitation and adult-oriented comedic fare throughout Mandarin dialect dominated Hong Kong cinema during the 70s. Previous to his tenure at Shaws, Tien Ching's roles were much more auspicious while under contract with Cathay/MPG&I as a young actor in the 60s where he had been elevated to leading man status in many Cathay contemporary romance and period action titles.
biography.name: Ching Tien

biography.bio: Feng Yu was born on October 7, 1951 in Taiwan as Lew Wa-Heung. She was an actress and assistant director, known for The Delightful Forest (1972), Le pirate (1973) and Ye he hua (1971). She died on May 27, 2015 in Queen Mary Hospital, Hong Kong.
biography.name: Feng Yu

biography.bio: Mei Sheng Fan was born on September 13, 1942 in Shandong, China. He is known for his work on Riki-Oh: The Story of Ricky (1991), The 14 Amazons (1972) and Magnificent Butcher (1979).
biography.name: Mei Sheng Fan

biography.bio: Man-Tzu Yuan was born on November 5, 1957 in Hong Kong, China. She is an actress, known for Infra-Man (1975), Na Cha the Great (1974) and Shaolin Martial Arts (1974).
biography.name: Man-Tzu Yuan

biography.bio: Dean Shek was born on October 17, 1950 in Beijing, China as Liu Wei Cheng. He is an actor and producer, known for Drunken Master (1978), Snake in the Eagle's Shadow (1978) and A Better Tomorrow II (1987).
biography.name: Dean Shek

biography.bio: Kang Liu was born in 1949 in Malaysia. He is an actor, known for La rage du tigre (1971), Chinese Vengeance (1973) and Golden Swallow (1968).
biography.name: Kang Liu

biography.bio: Yen Tsan Tang was born in 1948 in Luoting, Jiangxi, China. He is an actor and assistant director, known for Project A (1983), La danse du lion (1980) and Mavet (2005).
biography.name: Yen Tsan Tang

biography.bio: Shang Yun Liang was born in Guangdong, China. He is known for his work on Boxer from Shantung (1972), Le sabre infernal (1976) and Le pirate (1973).
biography.name: Shang Yun Liang

biography.bio: Tse Lin Yang was born in Zhongshan, Guangdong, China. He is an actor, known for God of Gamblers (1989), Five Fingers of Death (1972) and Chinese Vengeance (1973).
biography.name: Tse Lin Yang

biography.bio: Kuang Yu Wang is known for his work on La rage du tigre (1971), Chinese Vengeance (1973) and Vengeance (1970).
biography.name: Kuang Yu Wang

biography.bio: Kang-Yeh Cheng was born on July 26, 1948 in Shanghai, China. He is an actor and assistant director, known for Executioners from Shaolin (1977), La rage du tigre (1971) and Le génie du kung fu (1979).
biography.name: Kang-Yeh Cheng

biography.bio: Ching Ho Wang was born on September 23, 1919 in Fujian, China. He is an actor, known for Five Deadly Venoms (1978), La rage du tigre (1971) and Chinese Vengeance (1973).
biography.name: Ching Ho Wang

biography.bio: Ti Lu was born on January 27, 1924 in Shandong, China as Lu Hsi-chieh. He is an actor, known for Fen nu qing nian (1973), Les disciples de Shaolin (1975) and Na Cha the Great (1974).
biography.name: Ti Lu
